PAGE.TITLE: Difference equations
PAGE.DESCRIPTION:
The linear equation for the unknown vector $\mathbf{x}$, involving the
known vector $\mathbf{b}$
and the matrix, $\mathbf{A}$, with rank less than the dimension of $\mathbf{b}$;
$$
\mathbf{Ax}=\mathbf{b} \quad ,
$$
has a general solution that can be written in terms of the homogeneous solution
(null-space/kernel vector) and the particular solution:
$$
\mathbf{x}=\mathbf{x}_{\rm homo}+\mathbf{x}_{\rm part}
$$
where:
$$
\mathbf{Ax}_{\rm homo}=0 \qquad, \qquad \mathbf{Ax}_{\rm part} =\mathbf{b} \quad
.
$$

UL.LI: You should be able to explain the difference between a homogeneous difference equations and an inhomogeneous difference equations.
You should be able to solve homogeneous difference equations and inhomogeneous difference equations.
